title: Ticket #7286: the condor_config_val -write:upgrade option needs a better name
description:
The best way get a quick look at the configuration of a machine is condor_config_val -write:upgrade. This operation shows ONLY the knobs that differ from the defaults (it also has some special code to recognize old defaults)

it was intended as a way to make an 'effective config' after an upgrade - i.e. to delete knobs that have the same value as the new default. But in practice it's also a very good way to get an overview of the configuration of a machine you are not familiar with.

In this role, the option really needs a better name - and also it should probably print a few additional bits of information, such as the condor_version.

The new option will be called 

condor_config_val -summary
And it will behave like 
condor_config_val -write:upgrade -
. Writing the effective config to stdout and prefixing it with the condor_version of condor_config_val.

In support of this, we will also add the option 

condor_config_val -root-config <file>
which will specify that the root config file should be <file>, rather than looking in the usual places for the root config.
